Parameters: int: the era to represent, only 1 supported
of(int).Description: Obtains an instance of HijrahEra from an int value. The current era, which is the only accepted value, has the value 1

getValue().Description: Gets the numeric era int value. The era AH has the value 1.

Returns: the range of valid values for the field, not null
Parameters: TemporalField: the field to query the range for, not null
Throws: if the range for the field cannot be obtained
if the unit is not supported
range(java.time.temporal.TemporalField).Description: Gets the range of valid values for the specified field. The range object expresses the minimum and maximum valid values for a field. This era is used to enhance the accuracy of the returned range. If it is not possible to return the range, because the field is not supported or for some other reason, an exception is thrown. If the field is a @B_java#time#temporal#ChronoField_E@ then the query is implemented here. The ERA field returns the range. All other ChronoField instances will throw an UnsupportedTemporalTypeException. If the field is not a ChronoField, then the result of this method is obtained by invoking TemporalField.rangeRefinedBy(TemporalAccessor) passing this as the argument. Whether the range can be obtained is determined by the field. The ERA field returns a range for the one valid Hijrah era.

ClassDesc: An era in the Hijrah calendar system. The Hijrah calendar system has only one era covering the proleptic years greater than zero.
